intro: Smilax bracteata, commonly known as the Florida arrowwood, is a deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Aristolochiaceae and is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in spikes, followed by bright red berries. It thrives in moist, acidic soils and is often found in wetlands and pine flatwoods. Smilax bracteata plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing food and habitat for various wildlife species.
